structure.unit: Uniform Operation Of Commercial Motor Vehicles Act

law.catch_line: Driving Record Information From Registrar; Recording Of Convictions
law.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law to the contrary, the registrar shall furnish full information regarding the driving record of any person to the driver license administrator of any other state, or Province or Territory of Canada, requesting that information; to any employer or prospective employer upon request and payment of a fee as provided in section thirty-three of chapter ninety; and to insurers upon request. The registrar shall not mask or defer the recording of convictions on the driving record of the holder of a commercial driver license, in accordance with 49 CFR 384.226 or regulations promulgated by the registrar to reflect the applicable federal requirements. Upon request, the registrar shall furnish, within 30 days of receipt of the request, to any other state, or province or territory of Canada, complete driving records for at least the 10 years preceding the date of the request.
